intro: Miconia appendiculata, commonly known as the velvetleaf miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, dark green leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. It produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom throughout the year. Miconia appendiculata is also known for its ability to grow in a variety of soil types and its rapid growth rate, making it an invasive species in some areas.
